metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9794 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - negligible
metadata.Description: A vulnerability was discovered where specific command line arguments arenot properly discarded during Firefox invocation as a shell handler forURLs. This could be used to retrieve and execute files whose location issupplied through these command line arguments if Firefox is configured asthe default URI handler for a given URI scheme in third party applicationsand these applications insufficiently sanitize URL data. *Note: This issueonly affects Windows operating systems. Other operating systems areunaffected.*. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.6, Firefox ESR <60.6, and Firefox < 66.

criterions.comment: mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
